intro: Mosiera elliptica, commonly known as the ovalleaf mosiera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its elliptical-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
